title: How to Make Kemplang Tunu Fish Flavored Patties (Indonesian)

steps.headline: Mix the fish flesh with salt and warm water.
Add sago and wheat flour little by little.
steps.description: Mix into the fish flesh to combine.

steps.headline: Form the dough into tennis ball sized balls.
Press the ball until it is flat, forming patties.
steps.description: Press to a width of about 2-3 mm.

steps.headline: Dry the patties under direct sunlight for about 2 days.
steps.description: Place them on a food-grade mesh tray or bamboo tray that allows for airflow. You may wish to cover the patties with a fine mesh cloth to prevent insects from landing on them. Alternatively, you may prefer to dry the patties in an oven, using very low heat for several hours.

steps.headline: Prepare charcoal in an open fire or barbecue.
Hold the dried Kemplang patties with a split bamboo length or long-handled tongs.
Grill the patties over the charcoal.
steps.description: Hold the tongs over the charcoal, with the patty hovering about 30cm above the heat. Don't hold the patty too close, or it may burn.

steps.headline: Move each patty back and forth until it is cooked.
steps.description: The patty will puff out when cooked. Then repeat for each remaining patty.

steps.headline: Place the cooked patties in the jar or plastic bag.
Make the sauce that goes with the Kemplang patties (untuk membuat sausnya):
steps.description: Puree the chilies and shallots. Add sugar and salt to the sauce. Stir fry the sauce. Add a glass of water during stir frying.

steps.headline: When the sauce has been made, serve.
steps.description: Place the sauce in one container and the patties on a platter or in a bag, ready to eat. To eat, dip the puffed patty into the sauce and enjoy.

text: Making the Kemplang patties Mix the fish flesh with salt and warm water.  Add sago and wheat flour little by little. Mix into the fish flesh to combine. Form the dough into tennis ball sized balls.  Press the ball until it is flat, forming patties. Press to a width of about 2-3 mm. Steam the patties until cooked.  Dry the patties under direct sunlight for about 2 days. Place them on a food-grade mesh tray or bamboo tray that allows for airflow. You may wish to cover the patties with a fine mesh cloth to prevent insects from landing on them. Alternatively, you may prefer to dry the patties in an oven, using very low heat for several hours. Cooking the Kemplang patties Prepare charcoal in an open fire or barbecue.  Hold the dried Kemplang patties with a split bamboo length or long-handled tongs.  Grill the patties over the charcoal. Hold the tongs over the charcoal, with the patty hovering about 30cm above the heat. Don't hold the patty too close, or it may burn. Move each patty back and forth until it is cooked. The patty will puff out when cooked. Then repeat for each remaining patty. Flavoring the Kemplang patties Place the cooked patties in the jar or plastic bag.  Make the sauce that goes with the Kemplang patties (untuk membuat sausnya): Puree the chilies and shallots. Add sugar and salt to the sauce. Stir fry the sauce. Add a glass of water during stir frying. When the sauce has been made, serve. Place the sauce in one container and the patties on a platter or in a bag, ready to eat. To eat, dip the puffed patty into the sauce and enjoy.
tyn_model: split bamboo length or long-handled tongs
